metadata.Title: CVE-2016-3115 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
Multiple CRLF injection vulnerabilities in session.c in sshd in OpenSSH before 7.2p2 allow remote authenticated users to bypass intended shell-command restrictions via crafted X11 forwarding data, related to the (1) do_authenticated1 and (2) session_x11_req functions.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3115` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

openssh-client - 1:7.2p2-4
openssh-client-ssh1 - 1:7.2p2-4
openssh-server - 1:7.2p2-4
openssh-sftp-server - 1:7.2p2-4
ssh - 1:7.2p2-4
ssh-askpass-gnome - 1:7.2p2-4
ssh-krb5 - 1:7.2p2-4
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> with X forwarding enabled, could bypass ssh account restrictions

criterions.comment: openssh package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:7.2p2-4').
